data.text: English is one of 2 working languages and 6 official languages of the UN. Info on Monday's English Language Day here: https://t.co/2cNcBNu1jI https://t.co/DYt6Cu5AvV

What's happening this week at the UN? @UN4Indigenous Forum,  World Immunization Wk, #WorldMalariaDay, Chernobyl Remembrance Day & more. List of events here: https://t.co/HDzhfjBd02 https://t.co/0DyF2CRC6f

Monday is "Spanish Language Day" at the UN!
Follow @ONU_es to see our social media updates in Spanish 👇 https://t.co/VLhIndG3dW
On Monday's #WorldBookDay & every day, #StandUp4HumanRights to education and freedom of expression. More from @UNESCO: https://t.co/j3ANNX70kK https://t.co/Urm12qfNak
Dag Hammarskjöld is my reference and my inspiration in the work I try to do as Secretary-General of the United Nations. -- @antonioguterres at #dhlecture https://t.co/XWWU3k6EjC
UN Special Envoy for Climate Action @MikeBloomberg contributes $4.5M to @UNFCCC to support #ParisAgreement on climate change. https://t.co/YMQHeJzukX https://t.co/GzDCv2uVPV

Everyone can do something to help save our planet. Meet New Yorkers who are changing the world bottle by bottle and can by can. ⬇️
https://t.co/tXaiQwmaYp https://t.co/FG5klZiERJ
On Sunday's #EarthDay, UN Special Envoy for Climate Action @MikeBloomberg announces contribution to @UNFCCC to support #ParisAgreement on climate change. https://t.co/c8WJEOCIQK
On Sunday's #EarthDay we asked young people from around the 🌍 about their climate actions. Get inspired by them in our latest @Instagram story ➡️ https://t.co/UH4OQBPYqm https://t.co/axKg2TvC5n

At least 51 trillion microplastic particles are already in our oceans. Shrink your plastic footprint & take action for #CleanSeas. Here's how: https://t.co/0y09PmpgyH #EarthDay https://t.co/vORm6uSUTm
Happy #EarthDay from NYC! Here's how you can join people around the 🌎 to protect our one and only planet: https://t.co/tXaiQwmaYp #GlobalGoals https://t.co/XIEWuQ5eGR

.@UN_Spokesperson says @AntonioGuterres wishes the leaders of the two Koreas “every success in their courageous and important task of resuming sincere dialogue, leading to sustainable peace" https://t.co/Bns84FeDJp
This week we honoured 140 colleagues from 42 nations killed in the line of duty: 123 were military personnel; three police; and 14 civilians. #ServingforPeace https://t.co/1e36skQTfO

Depression is the leading cause of disability worldwide.
Depression can happen to anybody.
Depression can be treated.

Get more information from @WHO: https://t.co/psQphQtqoo https://t.co/3hNroSkkQp
Poverty can limit rural women’s access to prenatal care. Here's how @UNFPA is supporting rural midwives in Lao PDR. https://t.co/U6w5aHB6bC
Recently 60+ countries committed to double number of women military officers in @UNpeacekeeping by 2020. See how @UN_Women in Kenya is supporting women #ServingForPeace https://t.co/sReaWiQGYB

40M+ people are displaced in their own countries due to armed conflict, violence or human rights violations. The UN & partners launched a global plan to protect them: https://t.co/LKCjNRkw98 https://t.co/tVV2ZQLakW

I call on all Members to act consistently with UN Charter & int’l law, incl norms against chemical weapons. 

If the law is ignored, it is undermined. There is no military solution to the crisis; the solution must be political.

-- @antonioguterres on Syria at UN Security Council https://t.co/dF0grMgPbc
Starting now: Security Council meeting on threats to int’l peace and security, expected to discuss situation in Syria. Watch live: https://t.co/WhwXXmCYWf

"I urge all Member States to show restraint in these dangerous circumstances & to avoid any acts that could escalate the situation and worsen the suffering of the Syrian people." -- @antonioguterres following air strikes in Syria: https://t.co/Q57LPagtvj https://t.co/yVWXrF7nOQ
